Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder-section of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the exterior is covered with a self-slip, two parallel lines of cord-marked decoration around shoulder and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394425) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394425)
